thread.title: Juventus boss Max Allegri stokes flames that he is in line to replace Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger

author: rforrester
title: Juventus boss Max Allegri stokes flames that he is in line to replace Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger

organizations.name: team news sutton united vs arsenal

text:
'How's my English?' Juventus boss Max Allegri stokes flames that he is in line to replace Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger 
Italian is currently favourite to replace the Frenchman at the end of the season By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JUVENTUS boss Massimiliano Allegri has stoked speculation that he is in line to replace Arsene Wenger – by joking in his interview “How’s my English?” 3 Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri is the bookies favourite to replace Arsene Wenger 
And Allegri, who has refused to comment on speculation linking him with a move to the Emirates, was once again coy with reporters on Friday night. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
After watching his side thrash Palermo 4-1, he said: “How’s my English? 
“I started learning before Milan, now I’ve left it. They say I’ll go to Arsenal? You all say that, I just listen.” 
But the 49-year-old believes he doesn’t get the credit he deserves in his homeland and his relationship with the Italian press is making the ex-AC Milan boss seriously consider his future. Getty Images The Juventus boss has been taking English classes speculation over replacing Wenger heats up Getty Images Arsene Wenger is edging closer to an Arsenal exit after his latest humiliation related articles Preview Wolves vs Chelsea: When is the FA Cup game on, what TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? Sutton warn touts trading in gold-dust £600 Arsenal cup tickets that cards are marked and police involved Up for the Cup FA Cup fifth round LIVE - Minnows Lincoln City travel to Burnley before Huddersfield host Man City Team News Fulham vs Tottenham team news: Pochettino set to rely on youth for cup clash Hammers on Tour West Ham plot bargain move for PSG's Fode Ballo-Toure with left-back available for free this summer Team News Sutton United vs Arsenal team news: Wenger prepares his reserves to end the Cup fairytale Team News Millwall vs Leicester City team news: Leicester to rest big guns with one eye on the Champions League Team News Wolves vs Chelsea team news: John Terry set for Blues return Team News Blackburn Rovers vs Manchester United team news: Shaw, Rooney and Rashford set to feature against old rivals I will be a manager somewhere next season says Arsenal manager Wenger 
Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe and Borussia Dortmund manager Thomas Tuchel are also thought to be top of Arsenal's agenda to replace Wenger. 
Furious fans have been calling for the manager's head this week after suffering a 5-1 humiliation at the hands of Bayern Munich on Tuesday. 
And Wenger has admitted he could leave the club this summer but remains adamant it won't be his last job in management.
